After entering kidney failure, he’s got to pull off a contract killing before he croaks. But first, he’s got to battle through a variety of boorish characters including a self-righteous IRS honcho and a phony Medicare psychologist

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals of agriculture and technology that his family had, the tremendous Chicago Hurricane of 1921 which destroyed his hometown, his dropping in love with a teacher, his secret business with tachimail shop and countless ghost stories
